p: Severe dengue occurred with secondary DENV-1 and DENV-3 infection. It is known that secondary infections are more likely to be associated with severe disease than primary infections. In a meta-analysis demonstrating that likelihood of severe dengue varies amongst serotypes, primary infection with DENV-3 and secondary infection with DENV-2, DENV-3, and DENV-4 were more likely to result in severe dengue in South East Asia [ 49] than primary infection with other serotypes or secondary infection with DENV-1. Our results suggest that secondary DENV-1 infection might be more likely than previously realized to cause severe dengue in Indonesia.
